name: Accelerated Dual Degree: Bachelor of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Master of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering

Accelerated Dual Degree: Bachelor of Sci: Accelerated Dual Degree: Bachelor of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Master of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering The Accelerated 4+1 BS/MS Program in Electrical and Computer Engineering permits students to complete the 128 credit BS-ECE and the 30 credit MS-ECE (Track II: Non-Thesis option) in under five years, while keeping coursework at a manageable load and with a modest tuition and fee discount (at prevailing rates).
Undergraduate Program Requirements: 128: Undergraduate Program Requirements: 128 s.h. Undergraduate program requirements as listed in Bachelor of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering Please consult with your advisor to ensure you have taken all prerequisite courses for the Master’s courses (12 s.h. of graduate courses taken as an undergraduate student).
Accelerated Program Requirements: Accelerated Program Requirements * Up to 6 credits or 2 Specialized Graduate Program Elective courses could be counted towards the ECE Elective course requirements. Any graduate-level ECE course could be taken, upon the student advisor’s approval, to identify course-work that will provide expertise in the student’s desired field of interest.
Required MS Courses taken as a Graduate: Required MS Courses taken as a Graduate student: 18 s.h. As listed in the Master of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering

notes: Total Required Credits for the Entire Accelerated Dual Degree: 158 s.h. Minimum Required Grades and Cumulative GPA For details regarding satisfactory academic progress and graduation requirements, please visit Academic Program Policy Categories. Program Coordinator/Advisor Contact Information Jie Li, Ph.D. Engineering Hall 856.256.5345 lijie@rowan.edu
